alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 27 at 3:10AM EST until November 27 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A low pressure system will intensify over the Maine coast this morning. This will aid in increasingly strong southeasterly winds and offshore seas of 9 to 14 feet. These conditions will combine with the high astronomical tide for the month to produce minor coastal flooding late this morning. Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 2 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront & piers. Some roads may be closed with up to 1 foot of inundation expected. Areas of concern include but not limited to, Roque Bluffs, Schoodic Point, Seawall Road, Deer Isle Causeway, Deer Isle Oak Point Causeway, Cutler, Machias and Lubec. Splashover and some beach erosion is likely. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
